headline: As Amazon earnings keep tech rally alive, how long can it last?
summary: US stocks (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC) closed Friday's session in positive territory to end the trading week with gains across all three of the major averages, led by the Nasdaq Composite's 2.2% weekly surge that was buoyed by Amazon's (AMZN) post-earnings rally. This week on Wall Street was also marked by the earnings releases from Amazon, Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL), Meta Platforms (META), Microsoft (MSFT), and Apple (AAPL), and the Federal Reserve's decision to cut interest rates. ProShares Global Investment Strategist Simeon Hyman comes on Market Domination Overtime to talk about how Wall Street received this week's Big Tech earnings and what other sectors may be well-positioned to play catch-up to the Magnificent Seven. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

raw.headline: As Amazon earnings keep tech rally alive, how long can it last?

This week on Wall Street was also marked by the earnings releases from Amazon, Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL), Meta Platforms (META), Microsoft (MSFT), and Apple (AAPL), and the Federal Reserve's decision to cut interest rates. headline: Exploring Apple's True Worth as Stock Surges on AI and Vision Pro Advances
summary: Wondering if Apple’s sky-high stock price is truly justified or if there’s a hidden value beneath the surface? You’re not alone, and we’re about to dig in together. Apple’s share price climbed 2.9% over the last week, is up 4.8% in the past month, and has gained 10.9% year-to-date. Over the past year, the stock has returned 21.9%, and over five years, it has gained 133.8%. Recently, Apple’s stock performance has been shaped by ongoing developments in its product pipeline, including the...
